content: Today we reached the one hundred "15 days active" user milestone, a couple of weeks after reaching two hundred total https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/stats
Just a quick post to say thanks to this community. This January has been fantastic for mathlib. Look at this: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pulse/monthly
Before christmas I was complaining about a PR crisis, etc... but these statistics can't be denied. Thanks to everyone who contributed.
I think it's fair to say that Johannes has been especially fantastic at merging stuff
yikes, only 3 commits from me, I'm falling behind
He's a Pro, after all
I just updated my github profile and realized I can actually switch of the PRO badge...
hey, you got a face
Yes, I decided to show more beard than Chris :-)
aha, so there is a correlation between high commit count and beards
Sounds like a competition. Let's grow more beards!

yikes, only 3 commits from me, I'm falling behind

You should reassert your rank by pushing a huge theory. I propose differential calculus or linear algebra

Statistics for February 2019 (copied from https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pulse/monthly):
Excluding merges, 20 authors have pushed 122 commits to master and 312 commits to all branches. On master, 135 files have changed and there have been 6,934 additions and 2,684 deletions.

77 Merged Pull Requests
35 Proposed Pull Requests
1 Closed Issue
7 New Issues

Currently 46 Open Pull Requests
Congratulations to everyone (-;
In the past week 33 PRs were merged! Kudos and thanks to all maintainers. :tada: :thumbs_up:
thanks from myself and the other maintainers! I don't know if we got lucky but let's see what the next week brings
It might be something to do with ITP deadline now being in the past?
Oh or it might be something to do with mergify :-)
Maybe a bit of both :)
And a lot of hard work too
Yes, thanks to all involved.
